device_id.description: A device-specific identifier, such as the Identifier for Vendor on iOS

event_type.description: A unique identifier for your event

event_id.description: An incrementing counter to distinguish events with the same user_id and timestamp from each other

session_id.description: The start time of the session in milliseconds since epoch, necessary if you want to associate events with a particular system

insert_id.description: A unique identifier for the event. Amplitude deduplicates subsequent events sent with the same device_id and insert_id within the past 7 days

time.description: The timestamp of the event in milliseconds since epoch

event_properties.description: Arbitrary key-value pairs assigned to the event

user_properties.description: Arbitrary key-value pairs assigned to the user

groups.description: Arbitrary key-value pairs representing groups of users

group_properties.description: Arbitrary key-value pairs assigned to the groups listed in the 'groups'

$skip_user_properties_sync.description: When true user properties aren't synced. Defaults to false

app_version.description: The current version of your application

os_name.description: The name of the mobile operating system or browser that the user is using

os_version.description: The version of the mobile operating system or browser the user is using

device_brand.description: The device brand that the user is using

device_manufacturer.description: The device manufacturer that the user is using

device_model.description: The device model that the user is using

carrier.description: The carrier that the user is using

country.description: The current country of the user

region.description: The current region of the user

city.description: The current city of the user

dma.description: The current Designated Market Area of the user

language.description: The language set by the user

price.description: The price of the item purchased. Required for revenue data if the revenue field isn't sent. You can use negative values for refunds

quantity.description: The quantity of the item purchased

revenue.description: Revenue = (price x quantity). If you send all 3 fields of price, quantity, and revenue, then the revenue value is (price x quantity). Use negative values for refunds.

productId.description: An identifier for the item purchased. You must send a price and quantity or revenue with this field

revenueType.description: The type of revenue for the item purchased. You must send a price and quantity or revenue with this field

location_lat.description: The current Latitude of the user

location_lng.description: The current Longitude of the user

ip.description: The IP address of the user
